body_html:
@asimshankar Thanks for your explanation, but I still have problems building Tensorflow C++ library for Windows 10, even for CPU. I have replaced tensorflow_jni.so with tensorflow_jni.dylib in libtensorflow_cpu.sh and in BUILD file. I have also replaced libtensorflow.so with libtensorflow.dll and libtensorflow_cc.so with libtensorflow_cc.dll in these two files, as advised in one of the comments. Otherwise, I had error like this
"/tensorflow/tensorflow/tools/lib_package/BUILD:153:1: no such package '@png_archive//'" even though I have installed GNUWin32 which should also contain this package.
Still, the problem persists, as now it complains on the absense of package '@local_config_git//' . What should I do to fix it?

Also, simple including 'tensorflow.dll' from here https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/libtensorflow/libtensorflow-cpu-windows-x86_64-1.4.0.zip doesn't make package tensorflow visible in any way.
body_text:
@asimshankar   Thanks for your explanation, but I still have problems building Tensorflow C++ library for Windows 10, even for CPU. I have replaced tensorflow_jni.so with tensorflow_jni.dylib in libtensorflow_cpu.sh and in BUILD file. I have also replaced libtensorflow.so with libtensorflow.dll and libtensorflow_cc.so with libtensorflow_cc.dll in these two files, as advised in one of the comments. Otherwise, I had error like this
"/tensorflow/tensorflow/tools/lib_package/BUILD:153:1: no such package '@png_archive//'" even though I have installed GNUWin32 which should also contain this package.
Still, the problem persists, as now it complains on the absense of package  '@local_config_git//' .  What should I do to fix it?
Also, simple including 'tensorflow.dll' from here https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/libtensorflow/libtensorflow-cpu-windows-x86_64-1.4.0.zip  doesn't make package tensorflow visible in any way.
body:
@asimshankar   Thanks for your explanation, but I still have problems building Tensorflow C++ library for Windows 10, even for CPU. I have replaced tensorflow_jni.so with tensorflow_jni.dylib in libtensorflow_cpu.sh and in BUILD file. I have also replaced libtensorflow.so with libtensorflow.dll and libtensorflow_cc.so with libtensorflow_cc.dll in these two files, as advised in one of the comments. Otherwise, I had error like this
"/tensorflow/tensorflow/tools/lib_package/BUILD:153:1: no such package '@png_archive//'" even though I have installed GNUWin32 which should also contain this package.
Still, the problem persists, as now it complains on the absense of package  '@local_config_git//' .  What should I do to fix it?

Also, simple including 'tensorflow.dll' from here https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/libtensorflow/libtensorflow-cpu-windows-x86_64-1.4.0.zip  doesn't make package tensorflow visible in any way.
